6 Postnatal Care Guidelines 
WHO Recommendation 2013 Policy/Programme Action 
At 10–14 days after birth, all women should be asked about 
resolution of mild, transitory postpartum depression (“maternal 
blues”). If symptoms have not resolved, the woman’s 
psychological well-being should continue to be assessed for 
postpartum depression, and if symptoms persist, evaluated.
